{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3098049,"name":"TK4531","username":"TK4531","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tk4531/{size}/9605_2.png","created_at":"2022-11-14T15:33:17.147Z","cooked":"

We are working with our school’s theater department and making a robot prop for an upcoming musical. This prop really needs sound!

Has anyone added a speaker and code to play a sound clip?

We use the FTC blocks programming and there is a block to pre-load a sound as well as play it but I can not find any documentation on how to put this to use. Also, what kind of speaker would we need and where would be plug it in?

Thanks for any help!!

We haven’t specifically tested it, but a USB speaker connected to the Control Hub will probably work. Here’s a tutorial for the programming side: Home · WestsideRobotics/FTC-Sounds Wiki · GitHub
